result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 3:00 pm
INCLUDES 22CM749 & 22CM770.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person for ADA Natalie Zibolski.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Heather Roehr in person.
PO HOLD.
COURT QUASHES WARRANTS. 

VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

BOND: 
$500.00 Signature Bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): The Store (Stewart Ave)
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
PTC 09/29 @ 10:00 am
FPT 11/11 @ 10:45 am
JT 12/13 @ 9:00 am

ADDRESS: Salvation Army-113 S 2nd Ave. Wausau, WI 

Branch 4 Files.

Adjourned: 3:06 pm
